intro: Eriocaulon calocephalum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Eriocaulaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its reproductive structures are adapted for water dispersal, enhancing its ability to spread in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. Eriocaulon calocephalum plays a role in maintaining wetland ecosystems by contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
